amphipolis.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • amphipolis.controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class acts as the central coordinator (Brain) of the MVC architecture. It manages the game loop, enforces rules (turn order, landslide mechanics), and synchronizes the Model state with the View. Invariant: There is always exactly one active player during a turn. Invariant: The game state (playing vs. finished) is explicitly tracked. Invariant: The Controller maintains a valid reference to the Board and the Players throughout the game lifecycle.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game setup process. Pre-condition: The game must not already be running (gameFinished should be true or uninitialized). Post-condition: Initializes Players, Board, Bag, and starts the first turn.

      • startTurn

        public void startTurn()
        Begins a new turn for the current player. Pre-condition: A turn is not currently in progress (the previous player must have finished). Post-condition: The current player draws 4 tiles. If a Landslide occurs, handleLandslide is called.

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn()
        Ends the current player's turn manually. Pre-condition: The player must be in the "Action Phase" of their turn. Post-condition: Control passes to the next player index. startTurn() is called for them.

      • handleLandslide

        private void handleLandslide(LandslideTile t)
        Handles the special logic when a Landslide Tile is drawn. * @param t The landslide tile that was drawn.

      • checkGameOver

        private void checkGameOver(EntranceZone zone)
        Checks if the game should end based on the Entrance Zone status. * @param zone The entrance zone to check. Post-condition: If zone.isFull() is true, gameFinished becomes true and winners are calculated.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.lang.String filePath)
        Saves the current game state to a file. Pre-condition: The game is currently valid/running. Post-condition: A file is created at the specified path containing the serialized objects. * @param filePath The location to save the file.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loads a game from a file. Pre-condition: A valid save file exists at filePath. Post-condition: The Controller's state (players, board) is replaced with the data from the file. * @param filePath The location of the save file.
